exchange_account_add_emailAddress_hint:
The local part of your email address (the text before the '@') must comply with these rules:
  • It must start and end with a letter or a number.
  • Authorised special characters are ".", "+", "-" and "_"
  • You cannot have two special characters in a row.

exchange_account_add_password_hint_compl: For security reasons, this field must meet the following criteria:
Must not contain the display name or the name of the Exchange 2010 account (not case-sensitive).
Must contain elements from three of the following four categories.

exchange_ACTION_update_account_helpwizar:
You can change the Exchange account security policy, for example, by imposing minimum password complexity requirements.
Simply click on Configure your Exchange services in the control panel for your service.

Passwords must meet the following minimum requirements:

- Must not contain all or part of the account username
- Must be at least {{t0}} characters long
- Must contain characters from three of these four categories:
  • Lowercase letters of the alphabet (a to z)
  • Base 10 numbers (0 to 9))
  • Special symbols (e.g. !, $, #, %)
Password must be at least {{t0}} characters long
Hide the address in the directory

This option lets you hide the email address in the global Exchange directory, which all platform users can see by default. This means that you might not be able to share some elements (calendars, contacts). The autocomplete function may also be affected.
The Exchange GUID is the globally unique identifier of your mailbox

exchange_tab_domain_AUTHORITATIVE_info: Authoritative mode does not let you use another messaging system with Exchange accounts. This mode lets you activate Vade Secure antispam.
exchange_tab_domain_NON_AUTHORITATIVE_in: In nonauthoritative mode, your Exchange service can function alongside another email service. The Vade Secure anti-spam system is compatible if the POP/IMAP accounts are hosted with OVH (MX plan or hosted package). If this is the case, you will need to specify mx1.mail.ovh.net as a target email server.
exchange_tab_domain_noovh_mx_info: MX and SRV changes must be carried out manually in your DNS zone. You can find the necessary information in the associated domains section, once the CNAME has been validated.
exchange_tab_domain_modify_domain_toolti:
Vade Secure anti-spam is compatible with nonauthoritative mode (only if your POP/IMAP accounts are hosted by OVH). If this is the case, we recommend that you use: {{t0}}, {{t1}}, {{t2}} and {{t3}}

If you use nonauthoritative mode with email accounts that are not hosted by OVH, you must use: {{t4}} (see the "Associated domains" section)
exchange_tab_domain_modify_title: Are you sure you want to modify the following domain of your Exchange service?
exchange_tab_domain_modify_wizard_text:
By default, when you add your domain to the Exchange server, it will be in authoritative mode. This means that when you send an email to the address of the doain managed by the server, the server will only check to see if the address is on the Exchange server.

However if you switch the domain to nonauthoritative mode, when you send an email we will first check if the address is on the Exchange server, and if it isn't, the Exchange server will relay your message to the specified MX server.

You can use your domain in nonauthoritative mode if, for example, you want to manage some of your emails on Exchange and some of them on an External server.

Please note, if you want to use Exchange and OVH email, you have to enter the following value into the "Target email server" in the form on the left of the page : mx1.mail.ovh.net.

exchange_ACTION_add_disclaimer_helpwizar:
You can create one signature per validated domain.

Use the tools available to customise and format your signature.
This signature will be automatically added to the bottom of each message sent from the addresses associated with your Exchange domain.

Variables are also available to customise the generic signature with the contact details of different employees.

To add an image or logo, use the URL by inserting it after clicking on the "image" button.

exchange_tab_RESOURCES_wizard_intro:
Accessible via Outlook, the resource account feature enables you to plan for the requirements of your workers.
Naturally, you can create as many resource accounts as you wish.
exchange_tab_RESOURCES_wizard_type:
Two types of resources are available "Room" or "Equipment".
Simply provide the following settings:
  • Name
  • Capacity
exchange_tab_RESOURCES_wizard_example: Example: You want to reserve room "X" which can hold "N" people.

exchange_RESOURCES_delegation_wizard_tex:
Defining a delegate on a resource inbox allows you to manage the planning options and transfer all requests to the delegate(s) to be validated.

It also allows you to view the details of the resource calendar.
exchange_RESOURCES_description: Here you can create, manage and delete resources (equipment(s)/room(s))
exchange_RESOURCES_guide: For more information, view our guides
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_description: An email account diagnostic is able to verify several elements. It checks the MX and SRV records as well as the service, the webmail credentials and the delivery and receipt of emails. Please note, the diagnostic could take between 3 and 10 minutes.
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_stay_on_page_while_: If you leave the customer account web section, you will lose the results of the diagnostic.
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_input_email: Email account subject to the diagnostic
exchange_DIAGNOSTIC_launch_diagnostic_fa: There was an error launching the diagnostic
exchange_DIAGNOSTIC_get_diagnostic_resul: There was an error retrieving the result of the diagnostic
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isSpammer_ok: The account has not been blocked for sending spam
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isSpammer_no: PLEASE NOTE: The account has been blocked because it was sending spam
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isSpammer_he: This means that you will temporarily be unable to send email from your account.

Email reception is not affected. When your account is blocked because of spam you will see a SPAM tag in the "Email accounts" section of your Exchange service. Click on the tag to be taken to the email that you received after the account was blocked.
You must reply to this email to unblock your account.
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isSuspended_: PLEASE NOTE: Your subscription to this account has expired
In this instance your subscription will be deactivated, and you will not be able to send or receive email. Please contact the Exchange support team (020) 7357 6616 to reactivate your service.
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isLocked_ok: The account has not been blocked by the security policy
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isLocked_not: WARNING: The account has been blocked by the security policy
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isLocked_hel: You can set a security policy from your Exchange service. Your account may be blocked for a certain time period while the policy is being configured.
You can ask for the account to be blocked after a certain number of failed login attempts for a specified time period.
If your account is blocked, you can either wait for the specified time period to elapse or you can contact our Exchange support team.
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_connectiveOW: PLEASE NOTE: The webmail authentication failed
It may be that an incorrect password has been entered for the diagnostic test. In this instance you can start the diagnostic again.
You can also update your password from the email account tab in the Exchange section before launching the diagnostic test again. If the problem persists you can create a support ticket.
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isMxValid_ok: The domain MX record is valid
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isMxValid_no: PLEASE NOTE: The domain MX record is not valid
exchange_DIAGNOSTICS_status_isMxValid_he: This error means that email cannot be received and it is linked to the following error: Please note: The test email was not received.
MX servers valid for the Exchange service:
Exchange + E-mail pop/imap hosted at OVH: mx1.mail.ovh.net
Exchange + E-mail pop/imap not hosted at OVH: ex.mail.ovh.net ou ex2.mail.ovh.net

lockoutThreshold_unit_value_0: The account will never be locked
lockoutDuration_unit_value_0: The account will be blocked until an administrator explicitly unlocks it.
passwordHistoryCount_unit_value_0: You cannot reuse the current password.
exchange_ACTION_configure_services_passw: The user must change their password immediately.
The password will still be valid
exchange_ACTION_configure_services_never: The account will never be locked
exchange_ACTION_configure_services_help_: If you enter "0", the account will never be locked.
If you enter "0", the account will be blocked until an administrator explicitly unlocks it.
If you enter "0", you will allow instant password changes.
If you enter "0", the password will always be valid.
Determines the number of new unique passwords that must be associated with a user account before an old password can be reused.
If you enter "0", no password is required
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_lockoutTh: This security setting determines the number of failed login attempts that causes a user account to be locked out. A locked-out account cannot be used until it is reset by an administrator or until the lockout duration for the account has expired. You can set a value between 1 and 14 failed logon attempts. If you set the value to 0, the account will never be locked out.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_lockoutDu:
This security setting determines the number of minutes a locked-out account remains locked out before automatically becoming unlocked. The available range is from 1 minute to 90 minutes
If an account lockout threshold is defined, the account lockout duration must be greater than or equal to the reset time.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_lockoutOb:
This security setting determines the number of minutes that must elapse after a failed logon attempt before the counter is reset to 0. The available range is 1 minute to 90 minutes.
If an account lockout threshold is defined, this reset time must be less than or equal to the Account lockout duration.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_complexit:
This security setting determines whether passwords must meet complexity requirements
If this policy is enabled, passwords must meet the following minimum requirements when they are changed or created:
  • Does not contain all or part of the user's account name
  • Is at least 6 characters long
  • Contains characters from three of the following four categories:
    1. Uppercase characters from the English alphabet (A to Z)
    2. Lowercase characters from the English alphabet (a to z)
    3. Base 10 digits (0 to 9)
    4. Non-alphanumeric characters (for example, !, $, #, %)
Complexity requirements are enforced when passwords are changed or created.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_minPasswo: This security setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the user can change it. You can set passwords to expire after a number of days between 1 and 90, or you can allow changes immediately by setting the number of days to 0.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_maxPasswo: This security setting determines the period (in days) that a password can be used before the system asks the user to change it. You can set passwords to expire after a certain number of days between 1 and 90, or you can specify that passwords never expire by setting this number to 0. If the maximum password lifetime is between 1 and 90 days, the minimum password lifetime must be less. If the maximum password lifetime is set to 0, the minimum password lifetime can be any value between 0 and 90.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_minPasswo: This security setting determines the minimum number of characters that a user account password can contain. You can set a value of between 3 and 14 characters, or you can specify that no password is required by setting this number of characters to 0.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_spf_text: An SPF record is a type of Domain Name Service (DNS) record that identifies which mail servers are permitted to send email on behalf of your domain. If you enable this option a SPAM tag will be placed on emails coming from a domain with an incorrect SPF.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_dkim_text: DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) enables senders to link a domain name with an emai, thus vouching for its authenticity. This is done by "signing" the email with a digital signature, a field that is added to the message's header.  By activating this option, a SPAM tag will be placed on emails coming from a domain with an incorrect DKIM.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_spam_text: Apply a tag to an email identified as SPAM, which enables you to create an email rule in order to delete it or move it to a specific folder.
exchange_ACTION_configure_help_putinjunk: Automatically move emails identified as SPAM to the junk folder.

exchange_action_SHARED_add_help_message:
Shares are separate locations outside of your mailbox where you and other Microsoft Exchange users can create and view Outlook items related to a specific topic or project.
Shares appear in the folders list in the navigation window.
If you have the required authorisation, you can open individual shares to view and add content, and configure your own shares and give other users permission to use them.
An open element in a share has the same appearance as the elements of your own mailbox.

With the DNS zone, you can manage various services linked to your domain name.

DNS zone configuration

Since your domain name is managed by another NIC handle or service provider, you must update the CNAME record manually in your DNS zone. You will need the information below to begin adding this record.

With the CNAME record, you can validate your external domain name on the OVH platform. This record will not affect your domain's current configuration.

With the DNS zone, you can manage various services linked to a domain name. For example, you can link it to a web hosting plan using the A record, and you can link it to an email service using the MX record.
Enter the domain name
E.g.: domainname1.com

exchange_wizardHostedCreation_configureD: Your DNS zone will be configured in automatic mode.

Your Hosted Exchange service for the {{t0}} domain has now been configured. Once the MX diagnostic has been validated and turns green, you will begin receiving emails. Your service activation will take between 4 and 24 hours to become operational. View your emails by following this link
or in your General information tab, in the Connection → Webmail section.
Your DNS zone will be configured in manual mode.
By configuring the MX and SRV records,
, you are configuring your domain name so that it can receive your emails. You will be able to receive emails once your DNS zone propagates, and this can take between 4 and 24 hours.
The OVH MX record links a domain name to an email server.
With the SRV record, you can automatically configure your email address in your email software (e.g.: Outlook).
An error has occurred loading email accounts associated with your domain.
Now, you just need to modify your DNS zone's MX and SRV records for this domain.

If your domain name is registered with OVH, go to your Control Panel: Web → Domains → DNS zone.

If your domain name is registered elsewhere, please refer to your domain name service provider's documentation.

If you have already completed this action, wait or refresh your page. Once the MX diagnostic becomes validated and turns green, you will begin receiving your emails. Your service activation will take between 4 and 24 hours to become operational.
